asgn1Election

Class VoteCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • asgn1Election.VoteCollection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Collection

    public class VoteCollection
extends java.lang.Object
implements Collection

    Class to manage a collection of Votes as specified by the Collection interface. This implementation is based on a ArrayList data structure to enable convenient additions to the list.

    The private methods getPrimaryKey(Vote) and getPrefthKey(Vote, TreeMap, int) are crucial to your success. Some guidance is given for these methods through comments in situ, but this is generous, and well beyond what would be provided in real practice.

    As before, please note the name clash between asgn1Election.Collection and java.util.Collection.

    Author:
    hogan

    • Method Detail

      • countPrefVotes

        public void countPrefVotes(java.util.TreeMap<CandidateIndex,Candidate> cds,
                  CandidateIndex elim)
        Description copied from interface: Collection

        Method to distribute preferences from the candidate with index elim, the candidate with the fewest votes after the count of primaries and previous distribution of preferences

        The result of this method is that each of these votes will be distributed to the next highest active preference. This method is obviously specific to the preferential election.

        Specified by:
        countPrefVotes in interface Collection
        Parameters:
        cds - TreeMap containing the candidates still active in this election.
        elim - CandidateIndex referring to the candidate with the lowest number of votes; this candidate's votes will be distributed

      • countPrimaryVotes

        public void countPrimaryVotes(java.util.TreeMap<CandidateIndex,Candidate> cds)
        Description copied from interface: Collection
        Method to count the primary or first preference votes for each candidate in the election. This method is used in the simple election and in the preferential election prior to the distribution of preferences.
        Specified by:
        countPrimaryVotes in interface Collection
        Parameters:
        cds - TreeMap set of candidates. Number of votes for each candidate is increased by the number of votes from this Collection in which the candidate was the first choice.

      • updateInformalCount
